intro: Cannacorus indicus, commonly known as the Indian arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Araceae family and is characterized by its broad, arrow-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces edible tubers that are often used as a starch source in traditional cuisines. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in wetlands or near water bodies. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and agricultural contexts.
